content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
-----------------------
### Extraction System at position (–3.5, 27.5)
Consists of:
– Extraction system burner inserter located at (–3.5, 27.5) with a drop position at (–3.5, 28.5)  
Use-case: Initiates the transfer of copper plates from the extraction area into the belt network.

### Copper Cable Factory Interface at position (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of:
– Cable factory input chest at (2.5, 17.5)  
– New factory burner inserter at (3.5, 17.5) with a drop position at (4.5, 17.5) and using direction RIGHT  
Use-case: Serves as the receiving interface for copper plates that will be processed into copper cable.

### Belt Depot Structure at position (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
– Depot wooden chest placed at (3.5, 15.5) acting as an isolated belt depot  
– Transport belt segment adjacent to the chest at (4.5, 15.5)  
– Depot burner inserter placed at (3.5, 14.5) with a pickup position aligning with the depot chest  
Use-case: Functions as an intermediary transfer node, intended to receive copper plates from the extraction system before onward transport.

ERROR TIPS
-----------------------
• Transport Belt Connection Issues  
 – When connecting transport belts, do not target an entity that is interpreted as a Prototype.SteamEngine. Instead, add an inserter that inputs items into the target and use that as the connection point.

• Entity Placement Range Error  
 – Ensure the player has moved close enough to the intended target position (within the allowed placement distance) before attempting to place an entity.

• Inventory Shortage  
 – Confirm that the necessary item (e.g., a wooden chest) is present in your inventory before executing a placement command.

• Variable Naming Errors  
 – Verify that all variables (such as the intended target chest) are properly defined and referenced to avoid NameError exceptions.
